<h1 align="center">
  ðŸš€ Gatsby.js + Apollo GraphQL + Storybook + TypeScript
</h1>

Explore this repo's codebase to learn how you can setup Gatsby.js with `@apollo/client` GraphQL in TypeScript.

### Packages

Here's a quick rundown of the packages used in this project.

```json
{
  "dependencies": {
    "@apollo/client": "latest",
    "@storybook/cli": "latest",
    "storybook": "latest",
    "gatsby-plugin-apollo": "latest"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "typescript": "latest"
  }
}
```

### Apollo Client

The graphql client can be declared in Gatsby using [gatsby-plugin-apollo]() or by wrapping the root element with [ApolloClient.tsx](/src/graphql/ApolloClient.tsx).

```javascript

```

### Storybook

Storybook is used as a starter for example class components that perform the following functions: ``Query``.

```mdxjs

```

## ðŸŽ“ Learning Gatsby

Looking for more guidance? Full documentation for Gatsby lives [on the website](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/). Here are some places to start:

- **For most developers, we recommend starting with our [in-depth tutorial for creating a site with Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/tutorial/).** It starts with zero assumptions about your level of ability and walks through every step of the process.

- **To dive straight into code samples, head [to our documentation](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/).** In particular, check out the _Guides_, _API Reference_, and _Advanced Tutorials_ sections in the sidebar.
